pullRequest.title: Cosmos CFP: port V4 fix for handling partition splits
pullRequest.bodyText:
Bug fix when handling partition splits or partition not found. The cause of the bug is a typo in the call to log the current partition information such as the partition ID.
Bug fix when synchronizing lease updates across different threads.

commit.message:
Bug fix when handling partition splits or partition not found.
The cause of the bug is a typo in the call to log the current partition information such as the partition ID.
port CFP related fixes from V4; these changes address a raising condition where lease documents might have been updated on a parallel thread.

nodes.bodyText:
when a class is annotated with jackson annotation, jackson uses reflection for serialization/deserialization to json.
reflection is expensive and that being said, If there are pre existing classes in the code which needs to be serialized/deserialized to json we should ideally use a jackson serializer rather than annotating the class with jackson annotation.
(not necessarily in the scope of this PR, but something to be addressed outside of this PR).

@milismsft we need to have explicit automated tests for partition split.
We have some tests for partition split that you can use as a sample:
DocumentProducerTest (unit test)
ReadMyWritesConsistencyTest (integration test)
